cards.character_description_en: Moses is the leader of the Jewish people. He helped them leave Egypt and now takes care of them in the desert. Moses works very hard to help everyone - he listens to people's problems all day long! He loves his family and his people so much that he never stops trying to help them. In this parasha, Moses learns an important lesson: even leaders need help sometimes!

cards.character_description_en: Yitro is Moses's father-in-law. That means he is the daddy of Moses's wife, Tzipporah! Yitro is like a wise grandfather - he has lived a long time and learned many things. He was a leader in his own land called Midian. When Yitro heard about all the amazing things God did for the Jewish people, he traveled through the desert to visit Moses. Yitro saw that Moses was working too hard and gave him very good advice!

cards.image_prompt:
A vertical children's educational card in 5:7 aspect ratio (1500x2100 pixels).

=== STYLE ===
Vivid, high-contrast cartoon style suitable for ages 4-6.
- Simple, clear illustration of the concept
- Lines: Thick, clean black outlines.
- Educational but FUN appearance.

Card Format: 5x7 inches (1500x2100px)

=== RESTRICTIONS ===
- NO transliteration (phonetic spelling) anywhere
- NO QR codes
- NO Aleph icon in corner

=== CARD TYPE: POWER WORD (Hebrew Vocabulary) ===
Teaching: ×¢Öµ×¦Ö¸×” - Advice

=== CONTENT ===
Hebrew Word: "×¢Öµ×¦Ö¸×”" (with nikud)
Meaning: "Advice"
Torah Quote: "The thing you are doing is not good..." - Yitro to Moses
Example: "Yitro gave Moses good advice: Get helpers!"

=== VISUAL REPRESENTATION ===
A wise grandparent (like Yitro) giving advice to a younger person:
- Elderly figure with kind expression, pointing/gesturing wisely
- Younger figure listening attentively with lightbulb above head
- The lightbulb represents the "aha!" moment of good advice
- Warm, educational atmosphere

=== COMPOSITION ===
Layout (top to bottom):
1. HEBREW WORD (top 25%): "×¢Öµ×¦Ö¸×”" in LARGE beautiful Hebrew letters with full nikud
   - Decorative but very readable
   - NO transliteration below
2. VISUAL (center 40%):
   - Wise figure giving advice (gesturing)
   - Listener with lightbulb "aha!" moment
   - Clear, simple illustration
3. ENGLISH MEANING (10%): "ADVICE" in bold, clear, fun font
4. TORAH QUOTE (10%): "The thing you are doing is not good..." in elegant text
5. EXAMPLE SENTENCE (10%): "Yitro gave Moses good advice: Get helpers!"

=== FRAME ===
- Rounded corners (8-10px radius)
- Border: #2ECC40 Green (8px width)
- NO icon in top-left corner

=== MOOD ===
Educational and exciting! Learning Hebrew should feel like discovering treasure.
cards.teacher_script: Our Power Word is EITZAH! Can you say it? Eitzah! It means 'advice.' In the Torah, Yitro told Moses: 'What you are doing is not good - you need helpers!' That was such good eitzah! Who gives YOU good advice?

Meaning: "Listen / Hear"
Torah Quote: "And Yitro heard all that God had done..." (Exodus 18:1)

=== VISUAL REPRESENTATION ===
A child demonstrating LISTENING:

- Sound waves or musical notes coming toward the ear

   - Prominent and decorative

   - Sound waves coming toward ear
   - Eyes closed, peaceful concentration
   - Clear, relatable pose

- Border: #2ECC40 Green (8px width)
- NO icon in top-left corner

Peaceful and focused. Listening is a superpower! Children should want to practice listening.
cards.teacher_script: Our second Power Word is SHAMA! Can you say it? Shama! It means 'listen.' In the Torah it says 'Yitro HEARD all that God had done' - he listened! The Jewish people did shama at the mountain too. Let's practice - put your hand to your ear and listen very carefully!
